g4501.definition: [ῥομφαία] probably of foreign origin; a sabre, i.e. a long and broad cutlass (any weapon of the kind, literally or figuratively)

g4502.definition: [Ῥουβήν] of Hebrew origin ({{h7205}}); Ruben (i.e. Reuben), an Israelite

g4503.definition: [Ῥούθ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7327}}); Ruth, a Moabitess

g4504.definition: [Ῥοῦφος] of Latin origin; red; Rufus, a Christian

g4505.definition: [ῥύμη] prolongation from {{g4506}} in its original sense; an alley or avenue (as crowded)

g4506.definition: [ῥύομαι] middle voice of an obsolete verb, akin to {{g4482}} (through the idea of a current; compare {{g4511}}); to rush or draw (for oneself), i.e. rescue

g4508.definition: [ῥυπαρός] from {{g4509}}; dirty, i.e. (relatively) cheap or shabby; morally, wicked

g4509.definition: [ῥύπος] of uncertain affinity; dirt, i.e. (morally) depravity

g4510.definition: [ῥυπόω] from {{g4509}}; to soil, i.e. (intransitively) to become dirty (morally)

g4511.definition: [ῥύσις] from {{g4506}} in the sense of its congener {{g4482}}; a flux (of blood)

g4512.definition: [ῥυτίς] from {{g4506}}; a fold (as drawing together), i.e. a wrinkle (especially on the face)

g4515.definition: [Ῥωμαϊστί] adverb from a presumed derivative of {{g4516}}; Romaistically, i.e. in the Latin language

g4516.definition: [Ῥώμη] from the base of {{g4517}}; strength; Roma, the capital of Italy

g4517.definition: [ῥώννυμι] prolongation from ῥώομαι (to dart; probably akin to {{g4506}}); to strengthen, i.e. (impersonal passive) have health (as a parting exclamation, good-bye)

g4518.definition: [σαβαχθάνι] of Chaldee or ({{h7662}} with pronominal suffix); thou hast left me; sabachthani (i.e. shebakthani), a cry of distress

g4519.definition: [σαβαώθ] of Hebrew origin ({{h6635}} in feminine plural); armies; sabaoth (i.e. tsebaoth), a military epithet of God

g4520.definition: [σαββατισμός] from a derivative of {{g4521}}; a "sabbatism", i.e. (figuratively) the repose of Christianity (as a type of heaven)

g4521.definition: [σάββατον] of Hebrew origin ({{h7676}}); the Sabbath (i.e. Shabbath), or day of weekly repose from secular avocations (also the observance or institution itself); by extension, a se'nnight, i.e. the interval between two Sabbaths; likewise the plural in all the above applications

g4522.definition: [σαγήνη] from a derivative of σάττω (to equip) meaning furniture, especially a pack-saddle (which in the East is merely a bag of netted rope); a "seine" for fishing

g4523.definition: [Σαδδουκαῖος] probably from {{g4524}}; a Sadducæan (i.e. Tsadokian), or follower of a certain heretical Israelite

g4524.definition: [Σαδώκ] of Hebrew origin ({{h6659}}); Sadoc (i.e. Tsadok), an Israelite

g4525.definition: [σαίνω] akin to {{g4579}}; to wag (as a dog its tail fawningly), i.e. (generally) to shake (figuratively, disturb)

g4526.definition: [σάκκος] of Hebrew origin ({{h8242}}); "sack"-cloth, i.e. mohair (the material or garments made of it, worn as a sign of grief)

g4527.definition: [Σαλά] of Hebrew origin ({{h7974}}); Sala (i.e. Shelach), a patriarch

g4528.definition: [Σαλαθιήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7597}}); Salathiel (i.e. Shealtiel), an Israelite

g4529.definition: [Σαλαμίς] probably from {{g4535}} (from the surge on the shore); Salamis, a place in Cyprus

g4530.definition: [Σαλείμ] probably from the same as {{g4531}}; Salim, a place in Palestine

g4531.definition: [σαλεύω] from {{g4535}}; to waver, i.e. agitate, rock, topple or (by implication) destroy; figuratively, to disturb, incite

g4532.definition: [Σαλήμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h8004}}); Salem (i.e. Shalem), a place in Palestine

g4533.definition: [Σαλμών] of Hebrew origin ({{h8012}}); Salmon, an Israelite

g4534.definition: [Σαλμώνη] perhaps of similar origin to {{g4529}}; Salmone, a place in Crete

g4535.definition: [σάλος] probably from the base of {{g4525}}; a vibration, i.e. (specially), billow

g4536.definition: [σάλπιγξ] perhaps from {{g4535}} (through the idea of quavering or reverberation); a trumpet

g4537.definition: [σαλπίζω] from {{g4536}}; to trumpet, i.e. sound a blast (literally or figuratively)

g4539.definition: [Σαλώμη] probably of Hebrew origin (feminine from {{h7965}}); Salome (i.e. Shelomah), an Israelitess

g4540.definition: [Σαμάρεια] of Hebrew origin ({{h8111}}); Samaria (i.e. Shomeron), a city and region of Palestine

g4541.definition: [Σαμαρείτης] from {{g4540}}; a Samarite, i.e. inhabitant of Samaria

g4542.definition: [Σαμαρεῖτις] feminine of {{g4541}}; a Samaritess, i.e. woman of Samaria

g4543.definition: [Σαμοθρᾴκη] from {{g4544}} and Θτρᾴκη (Thrace); Samo-thrace (Samos of Thrace), an island in the Mediterranean

g4544.definition: [Σάμος] of uncertain affinity; Samus, an island of the Mediterranean

g4545.definition: [Σαμουήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h8050}}); Samuel (i.e. Shemuel), an Israelite

g4546.definition: [Σαμψών] of Hebrew origin ({{h8123}}); Sampson (i.e. Shimshon), an Israelite

g4547.definition: [σανδάλιον] neuter of a derivative of σάνδαλον (a "sandal"; of uncertain origin); a slipper or sole-pad

g4549.definition: [Σαούλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7586}}); Saul (i.e. Shaul), the Jewish name of Paul Compare {{g4569}}.

g4550.definition: [σαπρός] from {{g4595}}; rotten, i.e. worthless (literally or morally) Compare {{g4190}}.

g4552.definition: [σάπφειρος] of Hebrew origin ({{h5601}}); a "sapphire" or lapis-lazuli gem

g4553.definition: [σαργάνη] apparently of Hebrew origin ({{h8276}}); a basket (as interwoven or wicker-work

g4554.definition: [Σάρδεις] plural of uncertain derivation; Sardis, a place in Asia Minor

g4555.definition: [σάρδινος] from the same as {{g4556}}; sardine ({{g3037}} being implied), i.e. a gem, so called

g4556.definition: [σάρδιος] properly, an adjective from an uncertain base; sardian (3037 being implied), i.e. (as noun) the gem so called

g4557.definition: [σαρδόνυξ] from the base of {{g4556}} and ὄνυξ (the nail of a finger; hence the "onyx" stone); a "sardonyx", i.e. the gem so called

g4558.definition: [Σάρεπτα] of Hebrew origin ({{h6886}}); Sarepta (i.e. Tsarephath), a place in Palestine

g4559.definition: [σαρκικός] from {{g4561}}; pertaining to flesh, i.e. (by extension) bodily, temporal, or (by implication) animal, unregenerate

g4560.definition: [σάρκινος] from {{g4561}}; similar to flesh, i.e. (by analogy) soft

g4561.definition: [σάρξ] probably from the base of {{g4563}}; flesh (as stripped of the skin), i.e. (strictly) the meat of an animal (as food), or (by extension) the body (as opposed to the soul (or spirit), or as the symbol of what is external, or as the means of kindred), or (by implication) human nature (with its frailties (physically or morally) and passions), or (specially), a human being (as such)

g4562.definition: [Σαρούχ] of Hebrew origin ({{h8286}}); Saruch (i.e. Serug), a patriarch

g4563.definition: [σαρόω] from a derivative of σαίρω (to brush off; akin to {{g4951}}); meaning a broom; to sweep

g4564.definition: [Σάῤῥα] of Hebrew origin ({{h8283}}); Sarra (i.e. Sarah), the wife of Abraham

g4565.definition: [Σάρων] of Hebrew origin ({{h8289}}); Saron (i.e. Sharon), a district of Palestine

g4566.definition: [Σατᾶν] of Hebrew origin ({{h7854}}); Satan, i.e. the devil Compare {{g4567}}.

g4567.definition: [Σατανᾶς] of Chaldee origin corresponding to {{h4566}} (with the definite affix); the accuser, i.e. the devil

g4568.definition: [σάτον] of Hebrew origin ({{h5429}}); a certain measure for things dry

g4569.definition: [Σαῦλος] of Hebrew origin, the same as {{g4549}}; Saulus (i.e. Shaul), the Jewish name of Paul

g4570.definition: [σβέννυμι] a prolonged form of an apparently primary verb; to extinguish (literally or figuratively)

g4572.definition: [σεαυτοῦ] ; genitive case from {{g4571}} and {{g846}},                             also dative case of the same,      σεαυτῷ,  and accusative case      σεαυτόν, likewise contracted      σαυτοῦ,      σαυτῷ,     and      σαυτόν,    respectively; of (with, to) thyself

g4573.definition: [σεβάζομαι] middle voice from a derivative of {{g4576}}; to venerate, i.e. adore

g4574.definition: [σέβασμα] from {{g4573}}; something adored, i.e. an object of worship (god, altar, etc)

g4575.definition: [σεβαστός] from {{g4573}}; venerable (august), i.e. (as noun) a title of the Roman Emperor, or (as adjective) imperial

g4576.definition: [σέβομαι] middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to revere, i.e. adore

g4577.definition: [σειρά] probably from {{g4951}} through its congener εἴρω (to fasten; akin to {{g138}}); a chain (as binding or drawing)

g4578.definition: [σεισμός] from {{g4579}}; a commotion, i.e. (of the air) a gale, (of the ground) an earthquake

g4579.definition: [σείω] apparently a primary verb; to rock (vibrate, properly, sideways or to and fro), i.e. (generally) to agitate (in any direction; cause to tremble); figuratively, to throw into a tremor (of fear or concern)

g4580.definition: [Σεκοῦνδος] of Latin origin; "second"; Secundus, a Christian

g4581.definition: [Σελεύκεια] from Σέλευκος (Seleucus, a Syrian king); Seleuceia, a place in Syria

g4582.definition: [σελήνη] from σέλας (brilliancy; probably akin to the alternate of {{g138}}, through the idea of attractiveness); the moon

g4583.definition: [σεληνιάζομαι] middle voice or passive from a presumed derivative of {{g4582}}; to be moon-struck, i.e. crazy

g4584.definition: [Σεμεΐ] of Hebrew origin ({{h8096}}); Semei (i.e. Shimi), an Israelite

g4585.definition: [σεμίδαλις] probably of foreign origin; fine wheaten flour

g4588.definition: [Σέργιος] of Latin origin; Sergius, a Roman

g4589.definition: [Σήθ] of Hebrew origin ({{h8352}}); Seth (i.e. Sheth), a patriarch

g4590.definition: [Σήμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h8035}}); Sem (i.e. Shem), a patriarch

g4591.definition: [σημαίνω] from σῆμα (a mark; of uncertain derivation); to indicate

g4592.definition: [σημεῖον] neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of {{g4591}}; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally

g4593.definition: [σημειόω] from {{g4592}}; to distinguish, i.e. mark (for avoidance)

g4594.definition: [σήμερον] neuter (as adverb) of a presumed compound of the article {{g3588}}  (t changed to s) and {{g2250}}; on the (i.e. this) day (or night current or just passed); generally, now (i.e. at present, hitherto)

g4595.definition: [σήπω] apparently a primary verb; to putrefy, i.e. (figuratively) perish

g4596.definition: [σηρικός] from Σήρ (an Indian tribe from whom silk was procured; hence the name of the silk-worm); Seric, i.e. silken (neuter as noun, a silky fabric)

g4597.definition: [σής] apparently of Hebrew origin ({{h5580}}); a moth

g4598.definition: [σητόβρωτος] from {{g4597}} and a derivative of {{g977}}; moth-eaten

g4599.definition: [σθενόω] from σθένος (bodily vigor; probably akin to the base of {{g2476}}); to strengthen, i.e. (figuratively) confirm (in spiritual knowledge and power)

g4600.definition: [σιαγών] of uncertain derivation; the jaw-bone, i.e. (by implication) the cheek or side of the face
